required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Rehabilitation Evaluation and Optimal Physical Therapy (PRE-OPT)
clinical_study.official_title: Physical Rehabilitation Evaluation and Optimal Physical Therapy (PRE-OPT)

lead_sponsor.agency: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota

clinical_study.source: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 1: The investigators will conduct a prospective study to quantify the association between axillary web syndrome (AWS) and metastatic disease and chronic morbidities such as lymphedema, shoulder dysfunction, and pain comparing women (i) with AWS and (ii) without AWS in two cohorts of women. (n=200) Phase 2: This is a randomized controlled trial to 1) quantify the effects of (i) physical therapy compared to (ii) a control group in individuals with AWS following breast cancer surgery related to physical activity and physical impairments such as lymphedema, shoulder motion, function, and pain (n=44, 22 in each group). Funding to progress to Phase 2 of this trial has been obtained. It is anticipated 120 subjects participating in Phase 1 will be screened for eligibility for Phase 2 (separate consent and eligibility from Phase 1).

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical characteristics of preoperative Auxillary Web Syndrome (AWS)
primary_outcome.description: Status of lymph nodes in women who have preoperative AWS (lymph node metastasis present or not)
Range of motion (ROM) will be measured using a standard goniometer

secondary_outcome.description: Measured by 0-10 scale and Penn Shoulder Score questionaire
Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand questionaire
Measured by girth measures, tissue dielectic constant and bioimpedance spectroscopy
Measured by International Physical Activity Questionaire IPAQ (short form)
(present/not present) based on palpable assessment by investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Preoperative AWS and a positive lymph node status
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between AWS and a positive lymph node status
ROM measured by a standard goniometer
Measured by Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder, and Hand questionnaire
Difference in body mass index (BMI) between patients with and without AWS (pre and post operative)

arm_group.description: Patient will not receive physical therapy treatment or further instruction from the research team. The patient will receive standard care recommended by their medical provider which may or may not include physical therapy treatment.

intervention.intervention_name: Physical Therapy: Dependent on Patient's Needs
intervention.description: Therapeutic exercise: ROM: Begin with passive upper extremity ROM and progress to active ROM. Strengthening: Progressive upper extremity resistive exercises starting with light weights. Aerobic: Select a suitable, individual aerobic exercise program (walking, yoga, etc.) Manual therapy Soft tissue mobilization, myofascial release, and stretching of identified tight and stiff tissue. Lymphedema treatment Manual lymph drainage: Gentle lymphatic massage to lymph nodes and vessels by PT for 1-2 weeks. Instruct patient in self MLD to perform 1-2×/day for 10 minutes during the remaining weeks. Compression therapy: Gradient compression bandaging for daily wear with activities and exercise for 1-2 weeks. Instruct in self compression bandaging or issue a compression garment to wear with exercise or activity, or with worsening symptoms of AWS (i.e. cording extends down arm) or lymphedema.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18
- Patients (female or male) with a tissue diagnosis of non-invasive or invasive breast cancer
- Planned surgical breast cancer treatment (lumpectomy or mastectomy) with a minimum removal of one axillary lymph node by sentinel node biopsy. Contralateral prophylactic mastectomy or bilateral mastectomy is allowed.
- Voluntary written consent signed before performance of any study-related procedure not part of normal medical care
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients (patients unable to travel easily to the University of Minnesota Medical Center for post-surgery visits).
- Synchronous bilateral breast cancer
- Presence of a medical complication that would prevent the patient from being able to participate in the study, such as terminal cancer
- Previous history of upper extremity deep vein thrombosis
- Breast cancer surgery without lymph node removal

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota, Division of Physical Therapy

overall_contact.last_name: Linda A Koehler, PhD, PT, CLT-LANA

facility.name: University of Minnesota Masonic Cancer Center
